SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

org.azeckoski.reflectutils.beanutils
Interface FieldAdapter

All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultFieldAdapter, DynaBeanAdapter
public interface FieldAdapter

Interface that allows us to adapt to special class types like the apache dynabeans without requiring them to be a dependency unless they happen to be in the ClassLoader

Author:
Aaron Zeckoski (azeckoski @ gmail.com)

Method Summary

Method Detail

isAdaptableObject

boolean isAdaptableObject(Object obj)
Parameters:
obj - any object
Returns:
true if this object is part of the set this adapter is made to handle, false otherwise

isAdaptableClass

boolean isAdaptableClass(Class<?> beanClass)
Parameters:
beanClass - any class
Returns:
true if this class is adaptable, false otherwise

newInstance

Object newInstance(Object bean)
Returns:
a new instance of the adapted class type based on a sample

getPropertyNames

List<String> getPropertyNames(Object bean)
Parameters:
bean - any bean of the adaptable class type
Returns:
the list of property names for that bean

getFieldType

Class<?> getFieldType(Object obj,
                      String name)
Finds the type for a field based on the containing object and the field name

Parameters:
obj - any object
name - the name of a field in this object (can be nested, indexed, mapped, etc.)
Returns:
the type of the field (will be Object if the type is indeterminate)
Throws:
FieldnameNotFoundException - if the name is invalid for this obj
IllegalArgumentException - if the params are null

getFieldValues

Map<String,Object> getFieldValues(Object obj,
                                  ClassFields.FieldsFilter filter)
Get the values of all fields on an object but optionally filter the fields used

Parameters:
obj - any object
filter - (optional) indicates the fields to return the values for, can be null for defaults
WARNING: getting the field values from settable only fields works as expected (i.e. you will an empty map)
Returns:
a map of field name -> value
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the obj is null

getSimpleValue

Object getSimpleValue(Object obj,
                      String name)
For getting a value out of a bean based on a field name, mostly for internal usage, use getFieldValue
WARNING: Cannot handle a nested/mapped/indexed name

Throws:
FieldnameNotFoundException - if this field name is invalid for this object
IllegalArgumentException - if there is failure

getIndexedValue

Object getIndexedValue(Object obj,
                       String name,
                       int index)
For getting an indexed value out of an object based on field name, mostly for internal usage, use getFieldValue
WARNING: Cannot handle a nested/mapped/indexed name

Throws:
FieldnameNotFoundException - if this field name is invalid for this object
IllegalArgumentException - if there is a failure
FieldGetValueException - if there is an internal failure getting the field

getMappedValue

Object getMappedValue(Object obj,
                      String name,
                      String key)
For getting a mapped value out of an object based on field name, mostly for internal usage, use getFieldValue
WARNING: Cannot handle a nested/mapped/indexed name

Throws:
FieldnameNotFoundException - if this field name is invalid for this object
IllegalArgumentException - if there are invalid arguments
FieldGetValueException - if there is an internal failure getting the field

setSimpleValue

void setSimpleValue(Object obj,
                    String name,
                    Object value)
Set a value on a field of an object, the types must match and the name must be identical
WARNING: Cannot handle a nested/mapped/indexed name

Throws:
FieldnameNotFoundException - if this field name is invalid for this object
IllegalArgumentException - if there is failure
FieldSetValueException - if there is an internal failure setting the field

setIndexedValue

void setIndexedValue(Object obj,
                     String name,
                     int index,
                     Object value)
For getting an indexed value out of an object based on field name, mostly for internal usage, use getFieldValue
WARNING: Cannot handle a nested/mapped/indexed name

Throws:
FieldnameNotFoundException - if this field name is invalid for this object
IllegalArgumentException - if there is failure
FieldSetValueException - if there is an internal failure setting the field

setMappedValue

void setMappedValue(Object obj,
                    String name,
                    String key,
                    Object value)
For getting a mapped value out of an object based on field name, mostly for internal usage, use getFieldValue
WARNING: Cannot handle a nested/mapped/indexed name

Throws:
FieldnameNotFoundException - if this field name is invalid for this object
IllegalArgumentException - if there is failure
FieldSetValueException - if there is an internal failure setting the field
